name: Hampton Inn & Suites Memphis-Shady Grove Road

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here one night because we couldn't find lodging down near Beale Street. The hotel offered the comforts typical of the chain, including nice rooms and an adequate breakfast. As it turned out, the location did offer one big perk: it is very close to the Erling Jensen restaurant, where we had a sublime meal to belatedly celebrate our anniversary.
reviews.title: Convenient to highway, but not to downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hampton Inn is about 30 minutes to downtown and Beale Street. It was very easy to get around and the parking was free. The rooms we had was a one room suite with a kitchen. The room was okay with the exception of the water pressure in the shower. Free breakfast was okay, but still much appreciated. The hotel is about 15 minutes to Graceland and about 35 minutes to the casino's in Tunica, MS. The staff was very nice and i would come back here again if i was in Memphis.
reviews.title: Good Hotel at the quiet end of town

reviews.text: Wonderful place to stay and hotel was recently redecorated. Amazing value. Very comfortable bed too! Very impressive and will stay there again!
reviews.title: surprisingly, fabulous, beautiful hotel at a terrific value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel price also included breakfast but we did not eat there! Good coffee tho!
reviews.title: What a pleasant find.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in one of the best and safest parts of Memphis we felt like. Room was very clean and staff was nice. Breakfast was good with large offering. Couple of drawbacks was the small pool and thin doors but neither thing was that bad. Overall great stay for a weekend getaway.
reviews.title: More than we bargained for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night, and would recommend it. Corky's barbecue, which is one of the best in Memphis, is a little ways down the street from the hotel. Plenty of shopping in the area if you need anything. Maybe 20 mins to downtown Memphis.
reviews.title: Nice Hampton Inn

reviews.text: We booked 8 rooms at this hotel for a family members funeral that was being held nearby. Not only was the hotel very clean, but EVERY single person who worked at the hotel was so friendly - even the housekeeping which for those of us frequent travelers know is not normal.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel- very friendly and accomodating

reviews.text: It is not directly on Poplar avenue so you don't have a lot of outside road noise and the rooms are comfortable. I would absolutely recommend this hotel for business travelers, traveling with families, and for single travelers (very safe area).
reviews.title: All rond gret place to stay

reviews.text: We were traveling from NC to OKla for our holiday leave. Made reservations from the Hampton website as they offered the same rates as all the onine booking websites. $89.00 plus a few taxes was a very competative rate. We wanted something on the river but read many horror stories abut crime so we decided to try east memphis. What a great choice the hotel was locted in a very upscale side of town with many other high end hotels. There were many nice places to eat within a few miles. Corkies BBQ was excellent place for BBQ. The Front desk was well prepared and offered us a choice 5 different floors whic was unsuspected as we were traveling during the holidays. The rooms were what you expect from hampton, clean safe with those awesome mattereses and comforters. Great breakfast, friendly staff. We will surly stay again on our next trip thru.
reviews.title: great place for a family reunion
very nice
reviews.text: We stayed here for a dear relative's 99th birthday. Since he is somewhat incapacitated we did not want to be "out and about" alot. This was the most accommodating place! We brought in food and drinks and they gave us wonderful spaces for gathering. The rooms were excellent, the breakfast fine, and the prices amazingly fair. Strongly recommend for any groups.

I have stayed here a couple of times and for one night it will do in the winter but not in the summer. My air conditioner was very loud and impacted my sleep. The location is convenient for visiting my clients but the rooms could use some sprucing up. The door on my closet would not close and I had trouble with the iron. The cord kept retracting while I tried to iron my clothes. I could tolerate one night but I was there for two and the shabbiness of the room started to bother me. The air conditioner kept waking me up.
reviews.title: Needs Some Updating

reviews.text: This Hampton is the perfect example of why I only choose Hamptons!
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a business/ pleasure trip and couldn't have been more pleased.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!!

reviews.text: We went to Memphis to attend the Memphis in May BarBQ cook-off and to do some sight seeing. We booked a two room suite on the first floor for five nights.
reviews.title: Hampton Inn & Suites destroyed my 50th bday celebration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is about a 20 minute (easy) drive to downtown with plenty of restaurants/stores in between.
reviews.title: Good hotel in nice area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly service, clean rooms and comfortable surroundings - just as promised. Air conditioning unit in room made noises throughout the night. Good location to get around Memphis if you have a car. Parking is free. Great for sports teams, wedding parties. Keeping looking if you want romance or something with character.
reviews.title: Fit the Needs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were staying in this hotel to visit Graceland, Sun studios and Memphis in general.
reviews.title: Nice stay - relatively new rooms

reviews.text: Rooms were nice and flawless.
reviews.title: Very dissapointing

reviews.text: There is not much to dislike about this hotel - however, nothing really extraordinary as well.
reviews.title: Not bad, but geared more towards business guests.

reviews.text: After reading all of the positive reviews online, I expected much better. I have stayed in a dozen hapton inns and this has to be one of the worst. Dirty carpet, dirty walls, dated furniture in rooms. It is in a nice location, but I wish I had chosen a different hotel of the many nearby.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, within an easy drive to museums, zoo, and Beale St.

aka: Hampton Inn & Suites Memphis-Shady Grove Road Hotel
description: Easy access from Interstate 240 exit 15, East Poplar Ave, third light turn left. Located close to Memphis attractions including Germantown, Cordova, Bartlett and Collierville, TN locations. Stay for a weekend, sporting event or for business. Regardless of the reason you're here, we are glad that you are here.
